p: Around the world, educators are working to boost student interest in Science, Technology, Engineering and Maths (STEM). According to Scitech, ‘As we shift to an information-based, highly connected and technologically advanced society, STEM can empower individuals and communities with the problem-solving capabilities to meet unprecedented economic, social and environmental challenges’ [ 1]. In addition to developing interest in the STEM subjects themselves, we can inspire students by exploring scenarios that require a combination of STEM knowledge and techniques.
